qunit-xbrowser:interactive

Full name:

com.storyiq.oss:qunit-xbrowser-maven-plugin:0.2-SNAPSHOT:interactive

Description:

Goal which starts QUnit plugin in interactive mode. This allows developers to manually run QUnit tests in a web browser to receive feedback. Refreshing the QUnit test in the web browser will load any JavaScript code changes from disk, allowing easy TDD of JavaScript without having to restart any services.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven project to be executed.
  • Executes by direct invocation only.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
port int - The port for running HTTP access to the JavaScript files. When not specified the default will be 4200.
Default value is: 4200.
sourcePaths Mapping[] - The source directories containing the JavaScript code under test and any dependencies.
testSourceContext String - The HTTP URL that the QUnit test source directory should be mapped to. Defaults to the root e.g. "http://localhost/"
Default value is: /.
testSourceDirectory File - The source directory containing the QUnit test files. Defaults to "${basedir}/src/test/javascript"
Default value is: ${basedir}/src/test/javascript.

Parameter Details

port:

The port for running HTTP access to the JavaScript files. When not specified the default will be 4200.
  • Type: int
  • Required: Yes
  • Expression: ${qunit.http.port}
  • Default: 4200

sourcePaths:

The source directories containing the JavaScript code under test and any dependencies.
  • Type: com.storyiq.mavenplugin.qunit.Mapping[]
  • Required: Yes

testSourceContext:

The HTTP URL that the QUnit test source directory should be mapped to. Defaults to the root e.g. "http://localhost/"
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: /

testSourceDirectory:

The source directory containing the QUnit test files. Defaults to "${basedir}/src/test/javascript"
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${basedir}/src/test/javascript
